meanings.definition: One who hampers or obstructs progress.
meanings.sent1: The hamperer always found ways to slow down our project.
meanings.sent2: The team was frustrated with the hamperer's constant interference.
meanings.sent3: The hamperer's antics were like a roadblock on the path to success.
meanings.sent4: The hamperer was a dark cloud looming over our achievements.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the hamperer, for they can derail your plans unexpectedly.

meanings.definition: To hinder or impede the movement or progress of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Please do not hamperer our efforts to reach the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain hamperered our journey to the campsite.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hamperered the cat's attempts to catch it.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog hamperered visibility on the road, causing delays.
meanings.sent5: The tangled wires hamperered the installation of the new equipment.
